description: One of the most incendiary weeks in the decades-long shadow war between Iran and Israel ended with relief Friday after Tehran declared it had defeated what it said was a small attack on its territory by Israeli drones.
title: Week of Iran-Israel Strikes Marks a Mideast ‘Game Changer’

description: The fledgling US offshore wind industry took another blow Friday — but for a new reason: a desired turbine isn’t available.
title: How a Turbine Put The Brakes on NY Offshore Wind Projects

description: A deal to buy Paramount Global that includes Japan’s Sony Group Corp. would be expected to draw scrutiny from US regulators who vet media purchases by foreign buyers, as well as a review from competition authorities, according to Washington-based analysts.
title: Sony Deal for Paramount Would Draw Added Regulatory Scrutiny

description: A Philippine freight railway project may be built with the support of the US and Japan, an official in charge of it said, as Manila seeks alternative financing deals after dropping funding talks with China.
title: Philippines Wants US, Japan to Take Over Rail Deal Eyed by China

description: Colombian lawmakers added a clause to a pension bill in congress that will allow fund managers to rake in an additional $750 million in management fees.
title: Colombian Fund Mangers Eye $750 Million Fee Bonanza After Senators Tweak Pension Bill

description: At no stage this week did crude futures trade higher than where they were last Friday, before Iran’s attack on Israel.
title: Skittish Oil Market Enters an Uneasy Calm Over Middle East Risk

description: Israel is asking the US for more tank ammunition and tactical vehicles, three people familiar with the matter said, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government looks to replenish its stockpiles amid the war in Gaza and increasing tensions with Iran.
title: Israel Asks US for More Ammunition as Tension With Iran Rises

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US Treasury reporter Christopher Condon looks at how the world views strong US economic growth. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Good News, Bad News About the Surprisingly Strong US Economy

description: Mexico’s leading presidential candidate Claudia Sheinbaum intends, if elected, to evaluate the military’s role in the corporations that have been placed under its control by President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.
title: Mexico’s Claudia Sheinbaum Would Examine Role of Military in Companies

description: Rudolph Giuliani’s creditors expanded their probe into the former New York mayor’s finances, filing more than a dozen subpoenas in his bankruptcy case on Friday.
title: Giuliani’s Son, Former Aide Hit With Subpoenas in Asset Search

description: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s recent budget did not significantly change the fiscal track that the government laid out in November.
title: Macklem Sees Little Impact of Canada Budget on Fiscal Track

description: A man is in critical condition after setting himself on fire outside a courthouse in downtown Manhattan, according to New York’s police and fire departments.
title: Man Who Set Himself on Fire Outside NYC Trump Trial Is in Critical Condition

description: The UK government rejected the European Union’s proposal to negotiate a post-Brexit deal for young adults to move across the Channel more easily.
title: UK Rejects EU Proposal to Ease Travel for Young Adults

description: China’s ambassador to Canada has left his post after nearly five years, a period marked by heightened tensions between the two countries.
title: China’s Ambassador to Canada Leaves Post Amid Tensions

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz urged restraint to avoid a new bout of inflation that would prevent the European Central Bank from lowering interest rates.
title: Scholz Warns of Jeopardizing ECB Rate Cut With Inflation Rebound

description: Eleven rich countries including Japan, the UK and US proposed providing the World Bank with $11 billion in additional funds, which the bank says it could leverage up to $70 billion for lending.
title: Rich Nations Propose $11 Billion for World Bank to Boost Lending

description: The chief executive officer of one of Canada’s largest banks is speaking out against the Trudeau government’s plan to raise taxes on capital gains, arguing it won’t spur investment in the country.
title: National Bank CEO Slams Canada’s Capital Gains Tax Increase

description: Support for a Republican revolt against House Speaker Mike Johnson is building among party hardliners after he backed more Ukraine aid.
title: Ukraine Aid Stokes GOP Hardliner Support for Ousting Speaker

description: Poland plans to intensify its push for increased defense spending when it takes over the European Union’s rotating presidency in January, Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said on Friday.
title: Poland to Make Defense Top Priority During 2025 EU Presidency

description: The bribery trial of US Senator Bob Menendez and two businessmen was pushed back a week to May 13 by a judge who cited negotiations on a statement that averts the need to disqualify a co-defendant’s lawyer.
title: Bob Menendez Bribe Trial Moved to May 13 as Lawyer Stays on Case

description: Zimbabwe has asked the US to remind banks that Washington has recently eased some of its sanctions on the southern African nation.
title: Zimbabwe Enlists US to Help Remind Banks That Sanctions Eased

description: Armenia agreed to withdraw from several Azerbaijani border villages it has controlled since the early 1990s, a major step toward averting renewed hostilities between the two neighbors and reaching a long-elusive peace agreement.
title: Armenia to Cede Border Territory in Major Deal With Azerbaijan

description: Germany’s ambassador to Israel complained to Benjamin Netanyahu’s office after details of an alleged clash between the Israeli prime minister and German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock at a meeting in Tel Aviv were published in the media.
title: Germany Lodges Complaint After Report of Netanyahu-Baerbock Spat

description: Chad called on the US to withdraw its troops from an army base in the central African country that’s one of the West’s few remaining outposts to fight a roiling jihadist insurgency in the region, according to a letter from its air force chief of staff seen by Bloomberg.
title: Chad Asks US Troops to Cease Operations at Strategic Army Base

description: The US House advanced a long-stalled $95 billion aid package for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan, a breakthrough signaling an end to an increasingly agonizing wait for Ukraine and US allies in Europe.
title: House Advances Ukraine Aid, Tik Tok Ban With Democrats’ Help

description: The region that led the world into a promising cycle of interest rate cuts is warning that delays to the Federal Reserve’s own monetary easing pose a threat to its economic recovery, potentially exacerbating domestic political problems.
title: Latin America Sees Low-Rate Dreams Crumble and Political Woes Rise

description: Top diplomats from the Group of Seven countries leveled one of their strongest warnings yet against China, cautioning Beijing to stop helping Russia wage its war against Ukraine.
title: G-7 Warns China Against Aiding Russia in Its War Against Ukraine

description: Germany is looking at buying four additional Patriot missile-defense systems at a cost of as much as €1.2 billion ($1.3 billion) on top of the four Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s government ordered in March.
title: Germany Weighs $1.3 Billion Patriot Air-Defense System Purchase

description: Donald Trump attends his criminal trial as jury selection continues at Manhattan Criminal Court on April 18. Photographer: Brendan McDermid/Getty Images
title: Trump Takes Shot at Hush-Money Trial DA, Says Biden Runs Case

description: Twelve jurors were selected for Donald Trump’s criminal trial in New York, where the former president is accused of falsifying business records to conceal a sex scandal before the 2016 election. Picking the panel was an arduous process: Judge Juan Merchan, prosecutors and defense attorneys vetted almost 200 prospective jurors over three days to weed out people who might be biased one way or the other. Most who were excused said they couldn’t be fair.
title: Meet the Manhattan Jury That Will Decide Donald Trump’s Fate

description: Earlier this month, Kamleh Al-Yaseeni was supposed to accompany a friend to a hospice for the elderly in Damascus where they both volunteered, but she changed her mind to stay home with her disabled son, friends and neighbors said. It was a decision that would cost both their lives.
title: Iran’s ‘Axis of Resistance’ Watches Israel and Waits for Command

description: Croatia’s top court barred President Zoran Milanovic from becoming the country’s next premier, saying he violated constitutional provisions prohibiting an incumbent head of state from engaging in politics during a parliamentary election.
title: Croat Top Court Bars President Milanovic From Becoming Premier

description: The European Union formally approved sanctions Friday on violent Israeli settlers, a procedural step that required weeks of technical work as the bloc tries to balance its support for Israel with the need to address the worsening humanitarian crisis in Gaza.
title: EU Sanctions Several Israeli Settlers Over Violence in West Bank

description: A bid by senior regulators to soften the European Central Bank’s stance on lenders’ dividends and share buybacks is faltering amid pushback from hardliners and new Supervisory Board Chair Claudia Buch.
title: ECB Sticks With Tough Line on Bank Dividends Despite Pressure

description: The best rally in emerging markets this year hinges on the popularity of one person: Daniel Noboa, the 36-year-old heir to a banana fortune.
title: Top Emerging Market Bond Rally Tested in Deja Vu Ecuador Vote

description: Ukraine’s fate and perhaps even the security of Europe hinge on a man who six months ago was best known for his deep social conservatism, his evangelical Christian faith and his fierce defense of Donald Trump after the former president lost the 2020 election.
title: Ultra Conservative Mike Johnson Counts on Democrats for His Survival

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi Urges Strong Government Amid Global Unrest: India Votes

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Strike on Iran Leaves Middle East on Tenterhooks

description: A group of investors led by a Dubai-based real estate developer is in talks to build a mixed-use tower in Thailand that may vie for the mantle of the world’s tallest building.
title: Thailand in Talks With Group of Investors From Middle East, China to Build World’s Tallest Tower

description: As Joe Biden this week hailed America’s booming economy as the strongest in the world during a reelection campaign tour of battleground-state Pennsylvania, global finance chiefs convening in Washington had a different message: cool it.
title: Biden’s Hot Economy Stokes Currency Fears for the Rest of World

description: Iranian state media confirmed an attack by Israel in the early hours of Friday and said the “sabotage” operation involving drones had failed.
title: Iran Acknowledges Drone Attack by Israel and Says It Failed

description: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda said Polish authorities had detained two people over an attack on an ally of the late Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny in the Baltic nation’s capital last month.
title: Lithuania Says Two Detained in Poland Over Navalny Ally Attack

description: As Israel maintained official silence on Friday’s reported attack on Iran, its analysts and officials weighed in on whether the scale of the assault was a sign of strength or weakness.
title: Israel Debates If Reported Iran Attack Is Strong Enough Message

description: Understanding the stakes in the upcoming vote.
title: What AMLO's Legacy Means for Mexico's Upcoming Election

description: The European Union will be able to find a way to raise more joint debt that is acceptable to Germany’s constitutional court — if there is sufficient political will, according to Spain’s economy minister.
title: Spain Says Germany Can Find a Way to Make Joint EU Borrowing Work

description: Ukraine says at least eight civilians were killed and more than 20 injured in a strike on the Dnipropetrovsk region on Friday after Russia launched another barrage, straining the country’s dwindling air defenses.
title: Ukraine Says Eight Killed in Missile Attack on Central Region

description: Italy’s level of LGBTQIA+ inclusion has stopped improving and is now lagging advances seen in the rest of Europe, a new report showed.
title: Italy’s LGBTQIA+ Inclusion Levels Have Stopped Improving

description: Polls show that the country—which heads to the polls on May 29—could enter uncharted political terrain.
title: What If South Africa’s ANC Is Forced to Share Power?

description: Fighting involves scores of armed groups, deep ethnic tensions and at least five national armies, and has reached a peak not seen in at least a decade.
title: Rwandan Meddling Is Deepening Congo's Deadly Conflict

description: Iran shut airspace over the west of the country and its capital after Israel launched a missile strike, forcing commercial flights to reroute for the second time in less than a week as regional tensions escalate.
title: Iran Shuts Airspace, Flights Divert as Israel Launches Missiles

description: Pushing through a United Nations General Assembly vote to continue expert monitoring of North Korea’s nuclear arms development would require a “tremendous” effort and it’s unclear where funds would be found to have think tanks take up the role, the US Ambassador to the UN said.
title: US Sees Hurdles to UN Majority on Monitoring North Korea’s Nuclear Arms

description: Israeli soldiers at an Iron Dome anti-missile battery site near the Gaza border in southern Israel, on Wednesday, April 17, 2024. Iran’s unprecedented attack on Saturday night, lasting no more than several hours, came with a steep price tag, and points to the sheer expense of air anti-missile as nations such as Iran improve their drone and missile capabilities. Photographer: Kobi Wolf/Bloomberg
title: Israel Strikes Targets in Iran as Middle East Tensions Rise

description: Mayors of Colombia’s biggest cities, including Bogota, Medellin and Cali, ordered public officials to work normally on Friday, defying President Gustavo Petro’s call for a civic day to save water in the midst of a severe drought affecting the country.
title: Colombian Mayors Defy Petro’s Call to Suspend Work, School

description: The support rate for South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol fell to its lowest since he took office in 2022 after a stinging loss in an election last week that left him in a weakened positioned for the remaining three years of his term.
title: South Korea President’s Support at New Low After Stinging Election Loss

description: Israel launched a missile strike on Iran less than a week after Tehran’s rocket and drone barrage, according to two US officials.
title: Blasts Heard Near Air Base in Iran’s Isfahan, News Agency Reports

description: A burqa-clad women casts her ballot to vote in the first phase of India's general election at a polling station in Kairana, Shamli district, in India's Uttar Pradesh state on April 19, 2024. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP) (Photo by SAJJAD HUSSAIN/AFP via Getty Images)
title: India Begins Voting in World’s Biggest Election

description: Columbia University called in the New York Police Department on Thursday to dismantle a pro-Palestinian protest on campus, leading to the arrest of 108 students for trespassing.
title: NYPD Arrest 108 at Pro-Palestine Protest at Columbia University
